official-title.#text:
To restrict funds related to escalating United States
		  military involvement in Syria.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committees on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the
			 Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the
			 jurisdiction of the committee concerned

short-title.#text:
Protecting Americans from the
			 Proliferation of Weapons to Terrorists Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Prohibition on
			 funds to escalate United States military involvement in Syria

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, no funds made
			 available to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting Americans from the Proliferation of Weapons to Terrorists Act of 2013/s:2/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or any
			 other agency or entity of the United States involved in intelligence activities
			 may be obligated or expended for the purpose of, or in a manner which would
			 have the effect of, supporting, directly or indirectly, military or
			 paramilitary operations in Syria by any nation, group, organization, movement,
			 or individual.

does not apply to funds obligated for
			 non-lethal humanitarian assistance for the Syrian people provided directly by
			 the United States Government, through nongovernmental organizations and
			 contractors, or through foreign governments.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting Americans from the Proliferation of Weapons to Terrorists Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall cease to
			 apply only if a joint resolution approving assistance for military or
			 paramilitary operations in Syria is enacted.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting Americans from the Proliferation of Weapons to Terrorists Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report on assistance provided to groups, organizations, movements,
			 and individuals in Syria.

text.#text:
Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of
			 this Act, and every 90 days thereafter, the

term.#tail:
means humanitarian assistance
			 that is not weapons, ammunition, or other equipment or material that is
			 designed to inflict serious bodily harm or death.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 2492 IH: Protecting Americans from the Proliferation of Weapons to Terrorists Act of 2013
